result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(11:29 AM case called.) Court Commissioner Dan Smetana for Branch 2.
Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Nicholas P Thorson appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Zebulon Patek appeared by video for Nicholas P Thorson.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
State requests $5,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Attorney Patek requests signature bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $5,000.00 signature bond with conditions.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on June 20, 2022 at 1:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
